captions.text:
With a franchise-ruining sequel slash reboot
on the horizon

It's time to celebrate the 30th anniversary
of the film you loved as a child of the 80's,

Or the cartoon you loved as a child of the
90's,

Or the theme song you sort of recognize as
a child of today:
Bill Murray became a professional party crasher,
And Dan Aykroyd went batshit crazy,

"I don't think we will ever have a formal
relationship, a formal contact, with any alien

They were the Ghostbusters: old looking, out
of touch, out of shape nerds.

"When we get to 20, tell me. I'm gonna throw
up."

Yep, this is what movie stars looked like
in '84, kids.

When there's something strange in your neighborhood,
there's only one group of unlicensed heavily

armed, disgraced college professors you can
call:

"And if the ionization rate is constant for
all ectoplasmic entities, we could really

bust some heads -- in the spiritual sense,
of course."
"Will you stay here in bed til I get back?"

And Winston. Who was supposed to be played
by Eddie Murphy, but got more or less written
out of the movie when he passed on the role.

And eventually cropped out on home video,
too.

When ghosts rise from the dead to haunt New
York, the Ghostbusters are the only thing
between the city and total chaos

Causing the media to run glowing profiles
of their successful business

Instead of the fact that GHOSTS EXIST AND
ARE HAUNTING NEW YORK!

But it's nothing the Ghostbusters can't
handle:

And the vaguely scientific know-how to put
evil in its place.

"10 people witnessed a free-floating, full-torso,
vaporous apparition."

"You have been a participant in the biggest
interdimensional cross-rip since the Tunguska

I'm pretty sure he made half of that stuff
up.

Slide down the firepole and into a PG-rated
movie that children loved, even though it's
"I have seen sh*t that'll turn you white!"

Whoa. Kid's movies were way better back
in the day.

as the Ghostbusters take down the best snobs
the 80's had to offer
"Exactly what are you a doctor of?"

"$5000? I had no idea it'd be so much. I won't
pay it."

And imprison hundreds of innocent creatures
who don't do much besides
"I feel like the floor of a taxicab"

Kids, this was called a "library." It's
like a printout of Wikipedia where you have

comments.text:
"Whoa! Kids movies were cooler back in the day!" This guy wins the 
internet. Game over. He wins. Kids movies these days can't even show a hint 
of actual violence without causing a shrieking army of butt hurt, overly 
sensitive parents into an over protective frenzy over something that 
frankly doesn't even matter if you think about it for more the 2.3 seconds.﻿

comments.text:
"I'm pretty sure he made half that stuff up."
 
No he didn't! That's why it's funny. He's referring to actual science. The 
Tunguska blast of 1908 and the Philadelphia mass turbulence of 1947 really 
did happen!
 
You left out the funniest line about past life experiences stored in the 
collective subconscious intruding on present time.﻿
